On 11/30/06, Neil Swingler <neil@...> wrote:
>
>
> assert(that(n).g=
reaterThan(2).and().that(n).lessThan(10))


Sure, this works.  But honestly=
, compare:

assert(that(n).greaterThan(2).and().that(n).lessThan(10))

and
=

assert (n > 2 && n < 10)

I know which one I prefer to see in my code (not=
withstanding the fact that
it's not clear to me that lessThan means "<" and=
 not "<=3D").

Natural languages are great for humans but not so great for =
programming, so
let's exercise caution where we draw the line...
